meanings.definition: To firmly fix or establish (an attitude, idea, or habit) in a person's mind.
meanings.sent1: Reading positive affirmations daily ingrains a sense of self-worth.
meanings.sent2: Repeating a mantra regularly ingrains it in your thoughts.
meanings.sent3: Trying to remember all the capitals of the world ingrains them in your memory.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter ingrains joy in everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise ingrains confidence in her students.

meanings.definition: To work (a substance) into the surface or interior of something.
meanings.sent1: Rubbing the lotion gently ingrains moisture into the skin.
meanings.sent2: The painter ingrains vibrant colors into the canvas.
meanings.sent3: Mixing the spices well ingrains flavor into the dish.
meanings.sent4: The rain ingrains freshness into the earth.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor ingrains intricate details into the sculpture.

meanings.sent1: The touching story ingrains empathy in the reader.
meanings.sent2: The breathtaking view ingrains a sense of wonder in the observer.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected twist ingrains excitement in the audience.
meanings.sent4: His words ingrained a sense of determination in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The melody ingrains a feeling of nostalgia in the listener.
